intent.raw: Finish the Kith project — make it a usable GitHub replacement. Fix critical TODOs, build missing services (issues, SSH, importer), complete the frontend.

structured.summary: Complete Kith as a self-hosted GitHub alternative with full feature parity

acceptance_criteria.description: Git core object store reads/decompresses objects correctly
Issue tracker with full CRUD, labels, milestones, comments
acceptance_criteria.verifiable_as: Issue service builds and tests pass
Can clone/push via SSH on port 2222

acceptance_criteria.description: Access policy CIDR matching and time ranges work

acceptance_criteria.verifiable_as: npm run build succeeds in web-tanstack
Can import a GitHub repo with issues and PRs
Search API returns results for known content
Can fork a repo and push to the fork

domain_constraints: TigerStyle: no unwrap(), bounded collections, assert invariants
Rust backend with Axum, TanStack Start frontend
Event-sourced data models matching pr-service patterns

pipeline_timeline.artifact_summary: Audit complete. 113K LOC across 18 services. 6 critical TODOs, 10 missing features for GitHub parity. Three-phase plan: fix TODOs → build table stakes → migration tooling.

context_additions.content: Phase 1: git-core fixes, access policy, runner registration
Phase 2: issue tracker, SSH, code search, releases
Phase 3: GitHub importer, forking, container registry

pipeline_timeline.artifact_summary: 5 parallel sub-agents building: git-core fixes, access policy, issue service backend, issue frontend, SSH server. Queued: GitHub importer, code search, releases, forking.

context_additions.content: kith-git-core: fixing object read/decompress + pack index
kith-access-policy: CIDR matching + time ranges + runner ID
kith-ssh: SSH git protocol server with russh
